  physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. The background of the image contains buildings
 specifically that of high-rise flats. The majority of the photograph shows a farm with neatly divided plots of vegetation. A farmer wearing a hat can be seen working on the farm
 towards the right hand side of the image. On the left hand side of the image
 there are is a hut and a smaller shed beside it.

  subject_terms_1: farms urban development farmhouses farmers (people in agriculture) new towns (modern settlements)

  subject_terms_2: Farms Farmhouses Farmers Singapore Urban development Black-and-white photography New towns

  subject_terms_3: Photography Potong Pasir

  sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. This photograph shows a vegetable farm at Potong Pasir
 contrasted against new developments in the background
 signaling a time of resettlement and redevelopment taking place in Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. The background of the image contains buildings, specifically that of high-rise flats. The majority of the photograph shows a farm with neatly divided plots of vegetation. A farmer wearing a hat can be seen working on the farm, towards the right hand side of the image. On the left hand side of the image, there are is a hut and a smaller shed beside it.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. This photograph shows a vegetable farm at Potong Pasir, contrasted against new developments in the background, signaling a time of resettlement and redevelopment taking place in Singapore.
